article_title: Affluent More SRI-Focused Than Very Rich
article_text:
Among investors with a net worth under $1 million, about one in five has at least 25% of their investments in socially responsible companies, a new study says.

But among those with a net worth of at least $5 million, that number falls to about one in seven, according to Spectrem Group’s Millionaire Corner.

Younger investors and women also have a larger stake in socially responsible enterprises than older investors and men,...
